decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (332/4800a, 4001, 4100, 4110, 4111, 4150a, 4151, 4175, 4176, 4200, 4210, 4211, 4212, 4213, 4214, 4215, 4250a, 4251a, 4275a, 4276a, 4277a, 4278a received 04/10/2018) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - The construction hereby approved shall be in accordance with the details contained within the Construction Method Statement and Construction Management Plans as submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority as part of this application.

Condition : 5 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - The premises shall be used for B1 and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in Class B of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification).

Condition : 7 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate Constructors Scheme and compliant with its code of practice, and the details of the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by members of the public.

Condition : 8 - Prior to commencement of development, the applicant shall submit a method statement showing how the proposed development will be managed to prevent groundwater egress and flooding onsite. The statement should demonstrate how the risk of groundwater flooding would not be increased to the surrounding properties, it should provide information regarding how, in the event of groundwater egress, water would be removed from the basement and also include an evacuation plan for the users of the basement in the event of flooding.
Condition : 9 - The cycle storage as shown on the drawings hereby approved shall be made available for use prior to the occupation of the basement.
Condition : 10 - Tree felling and protection works shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations in the submitted Arboricultural Survey and Method Statements.

Condition : 11 - Prior to any works to install refurbished or replacement main entrance doors to the building, design details of refurbished or replacement doors at a 1:20 scale shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
description: Formation of a basement extension and internal mezzanine levels to provide additional commercial floor space (B1 use), replacement of roof, alterations to facade and forecourt of the building
